monq.jfa.actions

Class Printf

  • java.lang.Object
    • monq.jfa.AbstractFaAction
      • monq.jfa.actions.Printf
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FaAction

    public class Printf
extends AbstractFaAction

    implements an FaAction to apply a PrintfFormatter to the matched text. If a MapProvider is found in the DfaRun.clientData field of the calling DfaRun, this is passed on to the Formatter's format() method to allow for %(key) expansions. To store values in the Map, use Store.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.11 $, $Date: 2005-07-31 12:57:54 $
    Author:
    © 2003, 2004 Harald Kirsch
    See Also:
    format strings, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Printf

        public Printf(TextSplitter sp,
      Formatter fmt,
      int prio)

        creates an FaAction to format the matching text according to a Formatter.

        Parameters:
        sp - is applied to the match to separate it into parts. This may be null to indicate that submatches should be used. Another useful special case is covered by TextSplitter.NULLSPLITTER.
        fmt - is the Formatter to use to format the match. The most common implementation is the PrintfFormatter.
        See Also:
        format strings

      • Printf

        public Printf(boolean useSubmatches,
      java.lang.String format)
       throws ReSyntaxException

        create an FaAction to format a match according to the given format string.

        Parameters:
        useSubmatches - if true, the formatter will have access to submatches recorded during the match. If false only the format control "%0" is allowed and refers to the whole match.
        format - is used to create a PrintfFormatter.
        Throws:
        ReSyntaxException

      • Printf

        public Printf(java.lang.String format)
       throws ReSyntaxException

        creates an FaAction to format a match according to the given format string. This is a shortcut for

         Printf(false, format, 0)

        Throws:
        ReSyntaxException

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public void invoke(java.lang.StringBuilder out,
          int start,
          DfaRun runner)
            throws CallbackException
        Description copied from interface: FaAction

        is called by methods of DfaRun in case of a match. Parameter yytext contains the matching text from position start onwards. The callback may change the whole of yytext, but the under most circumstances, only the matching text should be changed. Parameter runner is the DfaRun object which called this function. Of interest are its fields DfaRun.clientData and DfaRun.collect.

        Throws:
        CallbackException

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
